projects/(projectSlug)/templates/new/pag.title: Create an agent template
projects/(projectSlug)/templates/new/pag.description: An agent template is used to define the structure of agents you deploy in your project. You can create an agent from scratch or reference a pre-existing agent template.

customerSupport.label: Customer Support
customerSupport.description: A template containing all you need to create personalized customer support agents for your customersagent

StageAndDeployDialog.title: Are you sure you want to version your template?
StageAndDeployDialog.details: This creates a version of your agent template that is immutable and can be used to deploy agents. Are you sure you want to proceed?

ADE/DeploymentAgentMangerPanel.emptyMessage: You haven't versioned this template yet. Click the button above to create a version of your agent template.

notFirstTime.title: Welcome back to the Letta ADE!
notFirstTime.message: Each agent has its own unique configuration based on your usage and is only visible to you.

firstTime.title: Welcome to the Letta ADE!
firstTime.message: The Letta ADE is where you can create, customize and deploy your agents. You can even arrange the windows to suit your workflow, just drag the tabs.
firstTime.more: We have took the liberty to create a template called <templateName></templateName> for you to get started. You can customize this template in many ways, here are a few things you can do:
firstTime.editMemoryBlocks: Edit your template's <memoryBlocksButton></memoryBlocksButton> and customize who your agent is and who it talks to.
firstTime.editDataSources: Attach <dataSourcesButton></dataSourcesButton> to your template so your agent can look up information from external sources.
firstTime.simulate: Use the <agentSimulatorButton></agentSimulatorButton> to test talking to a deployed agent
firstTime.exploreArchivalMemories: Explore the <archivalMemoriesButton></archivalMemoriesButton> of your agents (see what your agents have learned).
firstTime.evenMore: When you're ready to create agents from your template, you can visit the <templateVersionButton></templateVersionButton> and create a new version of your template, then follow the instructions on that page to deploy your agents.

login/LoginComponent.title: Sign in to Letta Cloud
login/LoginComponent.terms: By clicking the button above, you agree to our <terms>Terms of Service</terms> and <privacy>Privacy Policy</privacy>.
